name: Lyvi
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
tagline: A simple command-line lyrics viewer for various audio players
body:
![Screenshot](http://ompldr.org/vZmk2cg)

**Features:**

- Mouse support
- Displays lyrics, artist info and guitar tabs
- Optionally set terminal background to artist photo or album cover
- More than 20 providers (thanks to [glyr](https://github.com/sahib/glyr))
- Player control with configurable keybindings or statusbar buttons
- Cache for downloaded metadata
- Configuration file

**Supported players:**

- [Audacious](http://audacious-media-player.org/)
- [C\* Music Player](http://cmus.sourceforge.net/)
- [DeaDBeeF](http://deadbeef.sourceforge.net/)
- [Gmusicbrowser](http://gmusicbrowser.org/)
- [Guayadeque](http://guayadeque.org/forums/index.php?p=/wiki/page/Home)
- [MOC](http://moc.daper.net/)
- [MPlayer](http://www.mplayerhq.hu/)
- [Music Player Daemon](http://mpd.wikia.com/wiki/Music_Player_Daemon_Wiki)
- [pianobar](http://6xq.net/projects/pianobar/)
- [Qmmp](http://qmmp.ylsoftware.com/index_en.php)
- [shell-fm](http://nex.scrapping.cc/shell-fm/)
- [VLC Media Player](http://www.videolan.org/vlc/)

**User reviews:**

[Storm Dragon](http://stormdragon.us/?p=251)

### Get it!

Arch Linux: there is an [AUR package](https://aur.archlinux.org/packages.php?ID=60572)

For other distributions, configuration and more information, see [**Wiki**](https://github.com/ok100/lyvi/wiki)
